intro: Braya alpina var. americana, commonly known as American sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant features small, clustered white or pink flowers and has a rosette of basal leaves covered in fine hairs. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to cold, dry climates.
